com.percussion.pso.jexl
Class PSONavTools

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.extension.PSJexlUtilBase
      com.percussion.pso.jexl.PSONavTools
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.percussion.extension.IPSExtension, com.percussion.extension.IPSJexlExpression
public class PSONavTools
extends com.percussion.extension.PSJexlUtilBase
implements com.percussion.extension.IPSJexlExpression

Binding functions usefule for Navigation. These functions are intended to be called from JEXL.

Author:
DavidBenua

Method Detail

initServices

getAncestors

@IPSJexlMethod(description="get the ancestors for this node",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="selfNode",description="the current item"))
public java.util.List<javax.jcr.Node> getAncestors(javax.jcr.Node selfNode)
                                            throws com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionProcessingException
Builds a list of ancestor nodes. The first node in the list will be the Root node and the last node will be the Self node. If the Self node is the Root node, there will be only one node in the list.

This function can be used to generate breadcrumbs. Here is a simple example: 

 <div class="BreadCrumbs">
   #set($bpath = $user.psoNavTools.getAncestors($nav.self))      
   #foreach($bcrumb in $bpath)b
       #set($landing_page = $bcrumb.getProperty("nav:url").String)
       #set($title = $bcrumb.getProperty("rx:displaytitle").String)
       #if( $landing_page )
          <a href="$landing_page">$title</a>
       #else
          $title
       #end
   #end    
 </div>

Parameters:
selfNode - the self node, usually $nav.self
Returns:
The list of ancestors, including the self node. Never null or empty.
Throws:
com.percussion.extension.PSExtensionProcessingException

findNavNodeForFolder

@IPSJexlMethod(description="find the navon node based on the folder id",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="folderid",description="folder id"))
public com.percussion.services.contentmgr.IPSNode findNavNodeForFolder(java.lang.String folderid)
                                                                throws java.lang.Exception
Finds the navon or navtree in a given folder. The navon node is a regular content node, it is not a nav proxy node: the extra nav attributes are missing.

Parameters:
folderid - the folder id
Returns:
the navon as a node. Will return null if the navon cannot be found.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

findParentNavonNode

@IPSJexlMethod(description="finds the parent of a Navon",
               params=@IPSJexlParam(name="navonId",description="Content id of current navon"))
public com.percussion.services.contentmgr.IPSNode findParentNavonNode(java.lang.String navonId)
                                                               throws java.lang.Exception
Finds the for a current navon. Convenience method for findParentNavonNode(PSLocator). Note that the Node contains the content data only, the extra Navon proxy properties are not included in this node.

Parameters:
navonId - the content id of the current navon
Returns:
the parent navon node, or null if the navon has no parent.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                                               throws java.lang.Exception

Parameters:
navonGuid - the GUID of the current navon.
Returns:
the parent navon node, or null if the navon has no parent.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

Parameters:

Returns:
the parent navon node, or null if the navon has no parent.

java.lang.Exception

findNearestNavonPropertyValue

@IPSJexlMethod(description="finds the nearest non-empty value for a property",
               params={@IPSJexlParam(name="folderid",description="content id of folder"),@IPSJexlParam(name="propertyName",description="name of property")})
public javax.jcr.Value findNearestNavonPropertyValue(java.lang.String folderid,
                                                                                             java.lang.String propertyName)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
Gets the nearest property value for a named property. This method checks each navon for a value which is non-null and not empty. If the value is defined on the current navon is it is returned, and if not, the parent navon is examined, and so on until a non-empty value is encountered. This method will return null if no values are defined.

Parameters:
folderid - the folder id where the current navon is located.
propertyName - the property name.
Returns:
the nearest value, or null if no values can be located.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
